intro: Sarcanthopsis curvata, commonly known as the curved thornweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Sarcanthopsis curvata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
